content: On Touching—Jean-Luc Nancy is intentionally dated, get you to read him
meanings of le toucher (the touch, touching him, etc…)
what does privileging one sense exclude, what do the senses exclude? risk losing what the work (l’oeuvre) claims to opens up (prétend donner accès)?

a question about the day came of me, to me, w/out invitation, before the day, “she” watches over day, pre-phenomenological, trans-phenomenological: “quand nos yeux se touchent, fait-il jour ou fait-il nuit?”
Derrida determined to show limitless patience ready for infinite, time of experience itself
do eyes touch like lips? what is contact if it intervenes? a sealed interruption, or the continual, negating upheaval (relevante) of the interval—the death of btwn?
eyes see visibility of nothing visible, the gaze (regard), the clairvoyance—our first night
bénédiction au bord du pire, comme toujours > only beneficence if perversion is possible
that which touches: s’ils se carressent ou s’ils se donnent un coup?
pray that you’ll outlive me, survivor guilt > the only reconciliation w/ death: not to see those I love die
I could touch your eyes by approaching (m’approchant) you, if I dared
aporias, never through with them (those worthy their name), can’t see or touch their end
Aristotle on the aporia of touch, touch is adēlon: obscure, secret, nocturnal
acc. Aristotle, sense (only potential not actual): does not auto-affect itself w/out motion of an exterior object
Aristotle (Peri psuchēs): 1) touch is “inward,” internal 2) flesh is the “medium” 3) touch has for its object tangible & intangible (tou haptou kai anaptou) [a touchable un-touchable?]
limit, deprived of body, does not touch itself, does not let itself be touched
can only touch on a surface, peau, pellicule
how to touch untouchable? > la hantise of thought of touch—ou la pensée comme hantise du toucher
“soul,” “body,” “being”: I never understood these words, same for everyone?
storytelling as failure, renunciation
I dream one day some statistics [baby daddy] will reveal how often I used them (w/out confessing how unsure I was of their exact meaning)
rigor is de rigueur; “exact”: the probity of Nancy’s signature
Nancy stopped short one day (était un jour tombé en arrêt) before Freud’s “psyche is extended, knows nothing about it” > this is a beginning by freezing (par s’immobiliser)
aphorisms interest us because elliptical, testamentary: keep silence sur son lit de mort
for Freud, mysticism: self-perception outside ego—the id (Ich, Es) > or is it realm outside I and id
Kant quotes Fredrick the Great’s poems: a sign of his servile precaution and bad taste

Nancy’s partes extra partes, everything outside another outside; p. 14 fold of becoming-inside of the first outside, nothing but surfaces & outsides w/out insides: superficies of surfaces are limits, exposed to a touch that can only leave them intact, untouchable > irreducible disseminal divisibility
to say Psyche, essence, is extended [Freud], would raise (se lever) Descartes from his tomb
Nancy on Psyche: abandoned of her pose, radical solitude, alone in knowing nothing, alone for not knowing her extension
tôt (soon): d’avance dévoré par cet autre du temps, consumed, burned, tostus refers to instant, au temps sans temps d’une flamme > on the verge, it’s the end: no time for motion, trop tard
Psyche surrounded by exactitude of thinking men
vertigo of these concepts together: extension, partes extra partes, touch, se toucher ——no assurance when I touch a body, or touch myself, that extension is transcended
can one figure an untouchable extension? difficult except for intelligible extension w/out body (Descartes, Kant) or insensible sensible (Hegel, Marx)
Psyche the untouchable, and not only for others
nothing takes place but place (rien n’a lieu que du lieu), extensions tiennent lieu (taking place of) > every metonymy announces, remains a sign of mourning
incarnation of Psyche is “posthumous”—what does this do to psych-ology (life of living)?
publishing: risk exposure to so many metonymies
Psyche as life, breath: mourning life itself
penser le toucher en touchant à l’intouchable > injunction of impossible?
Aristotle’s Peri psuchēs (de Anima) is treatise on the pure life of the living
Aristotle’s Psyche is pure life of living, Nancy’s Psyche is a dead woman
knowledge of soul, acc. Aristotle, of the highest rank
death introduces drive of expropriation, but is still more tolerable than prosthesis, metonymic substitute, technical survival [l’intrus] (complicates incarnation even more)
Nancy’s distinction btwn orality and buccality, the latter a more “primitive” figure of the mouth, before speech?
[Nancy’s] garder: points to truth’s verity (veritas, Wahrheit), and economy; is garder compatible w/ retrait (withdrawal), w/ retenue (holding back, retaining)?

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: w/in apparent unity of epoch, abyssal dissynchronies promise completely other filiations

what embarrasses Derrida in word “generosity,” like “fraternity”: always refers to filiation, principle of “birth,” concerns “virility,” doesn’t include woman > if generosity is a capacity/force/power given at birth, can one still give?
very little use of “you” and apostrophe in philosophy
Derrida never considered Heidegger’s ‘epoch’ legitimate
the move from body extension to extension of psyche/thinking is incommensurable > a place (lieu) neither of objective space nor extension: place (lieu) as spacing before space
Nancy: “the incommensurable extension of thinking is the opening of the mouth” > mouth as union of soul/body; Nancy accords decisive authority to “quasi” in Descartes’ “quasi permixtio”
the quasi, the “as if”
Nancy is the thinker of exorbitant and exactitude
ex-; exscribed, Geworfenheit; conditions “sense of world,” ex-sistence
mouth, eyes: bordered openings, ces lieux quasiment sans lieu ——the “common” incommensurability of thought, which allows “psyche is extended,” is the “quasi permixtio” of body and soul
mouth before speaking, before orality, wouldn’t this be the mother’s lips, giving ex-
Nancy’s answer to how double extension self-touches remains elliptical, virtual, prethematic in Ego Sum: auto-affected & hetero-affected at once, uniting both affections like 2 lips
Nancy: mouth is neither substance nor figure
the 3rd, illeity of 3rd (not the 3rd man), begins justice, comes w/out waiting [w/out delay of differance?], affects face to face, but doesn’t interrupt the “welcome of the face”
Nancy’s 4 figures: 1) form of extension 2) fashioned 3) as trope 4) as visage (face)

the “without question” at the birth of “first question” (the question is the 3rd): passage (w/out transition) from ethical responsibility to political, juridical, philosophical responsibility (the move out of immediacy)
feeling oneself feel is not corporeal but spiritual for Husserl & Descartes

ineluctability (this is necessary) of the 3rd is law of question > question of a question, addressed to the other, from the other: the other of the other > a question that is certainly not first (comes after the yes of/to the other), though nothing precedes it
one must always, as a duty, imperative, reconstitute the ample, tight webbing (le tissu ample et serré) of a quotation—though it’s impossible
Nancy’s “saying too much,” a retracting by effacing, neutralizing its literality by dint of tropes
“I touches itself, I self touches (Je se touche)”: tactile figure of pure auto-affection

for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth

pure face to face as oath (serment) before the letter, debt before every contract or loan (emprunt), must perjure itself in bind w/ 3rd: in operation of justice can no longer distinguish btwn fidelity of oath & perjury of false witness
justice as law begins w/ perjury > violates; sigh of just man: “Qu’ai-je à faire avec la justice?”
Nancy’s intentionally pedagogical translation of Descartes

se toucher toi, “Je se touche”; “tu” [in philosophical discourse] signs general/plural singularity of possible addressee, also signs possibility/need for “I” to address itself as an other > oneself: first & last other

for Nancy, excès de la façon (fashioning) sur l’essence, et que l’une supplée l’autre, at origin of feeling oneself touch oneself; spectral revenant, prosthesis at heart of (self-)feeling > revenant, btwn life/death, dictates impossible mourning, sans fin—life itself [re: spacing irreducible to extensio]; p. 321n shouldn’t this spacing (what I call differance/trace) be linked to Heidegger’s tension of distancing (Gespanntheit) rather than Descartes’ extensio or even Freud’s Ausdehnung
isn’t the heart memory? isn’t it thinking of/as memory? ego touches its heart? we’ll guard the cardiogram of this cardio-logy > ghostly revenant at heart of (self-)feeling
Nancy: faceless mouth, structure of a mask
for Nancy, cogito neither point nor space, Nancy’s altercation w/ Descartes occurs btwn improbable pineal gland & a mouth from before speech > an opening anoral & already touching
Nancy’s Logodaedalus bursts (éclatant) w/ laughter of thought
Nancy’s Logodaedalus bursts w/ laughter of thought
“subject”: Kant’s word not Descartes’
acc. Nancy, laughter as philosopher’s presence to himself, contact successfully interrupted gives pleasure of syncope, pleasure of which it is depriving itself
acc. Nancy, Kant knows nothing about what links body/soul, points finger at Descartes for pure speculation
for Kant, touch is only immediate sense, founds other 2 objective senses: sight & hearing > hierarchical privilege of touch; touch occurs in fingers, fingertips [“haptocentric” tradition]
for Kant, only man has hand (telos): allows us to explore form, whereas coldness, heat, softness are just “vital”
for Nancy, always about touching the limit, the extreme, tip, point, that which can’t be touched
for Freud, the spatiality of space, exteriority, is a projection of an internal, psychical extension
multiplying questions: get carried away en touchant their loss of sense

transcendental ideality tied to empirical revision (one can thus understand & avoid Berkeley’s absolute idealism), pure intuition/sensibility maintains something of empiricism: extension (Ausdehnung) and figure (Gestalt), both of which are not sensation (impenetrability, color, hardness) [i.e. not animalistic]

transcendental psychoanalytic aesthetic (Kant may be a precursor) > how to have an apriori form of external sense, an already extended sense [?], a touch w/out empirical contact, sensibility touching nothing
for Kant, time is a priori formal condition of all appearances > question of pure auto-affection in movement of temporalization
for Nancy, the Thing touches itself when one touches nothing: exact hyperbole (Nancy’s writing) engulfs, exscribes itself (s’ex-crit), s’abîme (sinks)

Nancy tries to resist any idealism or subjectivism, even a thought of finitude where touch is never raw, always preceded by “desire,” “drive,” or even “my body” [Freud, Kant] > his insistence on touch as motif makes it a post-deconstructive, irredentist realism
animals die w/ too much touch: an originary prohibition, reserve of touch holds life on the brink (au bord) of exaggeration, touching a question of life & death
acc. Aristotle, touch: co-extensive w/ animal life, the genus of senses
in the beginning there’s abstinence: et le toucher parjure sans retard, unforgivably
Freud/Aristotle both interested in Psyche
Mary: Christianity’s indeconstructible [?]
Mary: Christianity’s indeconstructible [?]
Nancy: there is never “death itself”
Mary: Christianity’s indeconstructible [?]
Psyche as Mary, beautiful for being neither dead nor alive: surviving
Mary: Christianity’s indeconstructible [?]
Mary: Christianity’s indeconstructible [?]
absolute mourning of Psyche (life itself) > mourning mourning, mourning w/out work of mourning
for Psyche, for a psyche altogether exposed to outside & other, there’s no autobiography: mourning autobiography (not just any mourning)

following Nancy’s interpretation of The Death of the Virgin, [Life comme une Morte] a “tôt” announcing an apocalypse (an end not a future) > night of nonknowledge, every desire gathers momentum, Psyche ex-posed to other, surrendered but all too soon denied to the other’s eyes
Nancy: philosophy as work of mourning, work of representation, incorporation, profits from death (jouir de la mort), philosophy doesn’t know true mourning (w/out limits: ashes & tears)
being unimaginable gives rise to phantasms, allegories, figures, metonymies: technics > no overcoming (surmonté) this mourning w/out mourning [of autobiography] by any "work of mourning”
for Nancy, our world is in touch: auto-affects, hetero-affects itself
the haptical, for every finite existence, recalls what is coming [Socrates], marks the limit at which or from which the presentation announces itself
living moment of life an interiorization or expulsion? becoming-tangible of untouchable or an idealization?
Dechristianization is a Christian victory [flame of spirituality]

Christianity confusedly/surely informs doxa of mondialisation—can globalization of world be dechristianized? > “à moins, murmure le trouble-fête (spoilsport) que je reste,” lighting votive candles, Christianity carries w/in itself resource/law of destricturation, passage beyond itself
“if there is deconstruction to do, Christianity is it (period)”

Plato, Hegel, Marx, Luther’s destructio (Heidegger’s Destruktion is close): certain Christianity will always take charge of most exact, eschatological hyperbole—if deconstruction is possible must untie itself from destructio [p. 326n]
as if “touch in itself” were touching blood [Nancy’s self-expulsion] > rapport entre le sang et le sens, entre le ‘coup de sens’ et le ‘coup de sang’ [sens, sang, cent, sans]
flesh (sarx), Nancy’s Corpus is sarcastic, having it out w/ flesh, flesh of Christ
Christianity a religion of blood > beyond point where any religion begins w/ experience of blood
madness: [Nancy] “world is its own rejection,” condition of thinking the event > just madness, call for different thinking of the just
Nancy: ex-, ambivalent effects of all narcissism

when Nancy gives thought to birth of body, it’s sarcastic [having it out w/ flesh], mordant, une transsubstantiation acharnée qui inlassablement mord, remord et met à mort la chair > impossible auto-biography, transubstantiation of Eucharist itself: Corpus bursts out laughing
unlike Nancy, Derrida endlessly thinks about death w/out having had a change of hearts [socratic irony? also literal reference to Nancy’s surgery]
Levinas compares his illeity to unimpeachable witness in Descartes’ 3rd Meditation
“illeity,” sometimes designates interruption of face to face, sometimes very transcendence of the face in the face-to-face (a certain experience of “feminine alterity”): He (Il) in the depth of you

Nancy’s thought of touch as flailing, weighing, scales or scourge of God (all senses of French fléau), exapropriation of most proper, autoimmune desire of proper, expulsion: eating one’s heart out > “saisie dessaisie ou dessaisissante (a seizing put-upon or at grips with one’s grasp)”
unleavened bread—throbbing, bloody heart
Nancy’s 4 metaphorical displacements of touch: 1) not to “touch” 2) finishing “touch” of pure Idea 3) anesthesia/euthanasia “as soon as it is touched…” 4) longing for touch
unleavened bread—throbbing, bloody heart
Nancy’s virtuosity w/ word touch (master of language) > or is this simply a symptom of a haunting obsession, a dread, w/in language itself?
don’t have to wait until Hegel’s Pheno… before suffering wounds of sense-certainty
“this” and “here” of body (its sublimating idealization) makes it inaccessible to touch > an anesthesia of anesthesia, euthanasia contract
waking from anesthesia, sense certainty becomes madness > Rimbaud: senses in disarray

for Nancy, history of world/body is Christian? or is it a universal “history”? or the history of the production of every “universalism,” “mondialisation”—through the obligatory passage of a surreptitious, autoimmune, globalatinizing Christianization? couldn’t every culture have produced this idealizing anesthesia, this neutralization, this euthanasia of the body?
Nancy: writing touches the body
[is Christianity the only idealizing anesthesia, neutralization, universalism—or one case?]
corps-corpse > when Freud lays Psyche on couch is he referring to the Christian body? to say Psyche is “extended,” is to say she remains tangible (against Kant, Descartes)

“Torah before Sinai,” law before event, recognition of Torah by those for whom event of Sinai means nothing? a recognition by some 3rd, that would replace unique w/ unique? > a universal message in election of Israel (humanitarian hospitality uprooted from singularity of event, which becomes empirical, allegorical, “political” in restricted sense) [see p. 72]

law of law > law of tact: must touch w/out touching, ne pas toucher [touch/tamper] à la chose même, & 1st of all—the law itself, the untouchable > kept at a distance by the gaze (regard), respect law rather than person, respect law as the cause of respect
il y a la (là) du tact > given as given as much as ordered (do touch but avoid contact)
tact: knowing how to touch w/out touching

untouchable before vow of abstinence [cf. OG p. 109 spacing prior to prohibition of names]? a vow of abstinence requires promise of touch > touch haunting abstinence itself, intensifying transgression: unforgivable perjury at heart of interdict
touching remains limitrophe > an inhibition constitutes its appetite: it eats w/out eating what it comes to cultivate, elevate, educate, dresser (train), trephein
touch who, touch what, coup, caress, biting kiss

do but do not touch > this is not a formula, contact sans contact is madness! somnambulist reproduction of paradoxical formulas is always possible [Heidegger, Intro…] > tact discredits every opposition (esp. nature/culture) because if law is a commandment that interrupts continuity w/ “nature,” it already occurs with touch, well before man, before distinction btwn beings/living [touch as animal life itself—Aristotle]
the who of the touch not necessarily human or male
syncope of heartbeat gives rhythm to pulse or haptical compulsion: the cum of con-tact, a link where disconnection remains at work
has Derrida singled out frapper, caresser for pedagogical, provisional convenience—tie them to later texts?
caresser, frapper
Nancy does not directly analyze sexual difference [re: list of touches], which doesn’t mean it is not taken into account
Derrida has us imagine future philosophers studying Nancy [has the fantasy become impossible? isn’t he already that future philosopher?]
Nancy moves from Psyche is extended to body weighs (i.e. thinks) [penser, peser]
Nancy thinks necessity of undecidables re: thought/weight > there will be identical/analogous necessity re: subject of touching

motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

content: Nancy remains an exacting, rigorous, philosopher where limits tremble (impossible, undecidable), trembles w/out trembling, submits to trembling
Hegel on German, the good luck of a language originally speculative [i.e. Aufhebung, denken and danken]
Nancy: “la pensée pèse exactement le poids du sens” (Derrida points out transitive/intransitive double meaning of pèse)
contamination becomes what it is not: disidentifies/disappropriates everything before it disidentifies itself > attains the ex-propriety of the proper

caress, to take or give pleasure?; the order/command “Tiens!” [TN. there, here, hold on to this, take it] is not the same order as tact (the trembling, relinquishment [dessaisissement] at heart of seizing [saisie]) [beyond Lacan’s: “never give up on your desire”?]
the 3 neutral touches: 1) theoretical touch, as epistemic, knowing an object 2) pre-drive touch 3) phenomenological neutralization, a “reduction,” leaving intact intentional modes
caress, voluptuousness, contact beyond contact: beyond light (phenomenality), totality [Derrida doesn’t linger on Levinas’ hasty conclusions re: food, sexuation]
Levinas’ language is hostage to rhetoric as he describes what Derrida risks calling quasi-messianic: “not yet, from a future never future enough” where “caress aims at the tender”
Derrida compares Levinas’ caress to the event, but wonders it if it’s simply valid for any event worth the name
“exorbitant ultramateriality,” “paroxysm of materiality”
feminine as untouchable threat that threatens Levinas’ ethics [face]
Levinas has the courage [?] to say man caresses the untouchable of the feminine (the caressed) [see POOF where Aristotle privileges the lover over the beloved]
promise comprised of threat: automatic deconstruction of classical definition
this equivocation [re: Levinas’ caress] of negation w/out negativity marked by recurrence of “as if” and “without” (x w/out x, “essence of this non-essence”)
the threat of beyond the ethical, beyond the face: equivocation of caress
caress: pure experience before concept
Levinas’ feminine, profanation, the uncovering of the hidden still hidden, young animal, irresponsible animality, a not Good epekeina tēs ousias, uncovered virginity, mortuary mask
to avoid neutralizing sexual difference(s) [in the name of the neutral] should one favor dissymmetry & presumed sexual identity of the signatory?
Levinas: “equivocation constitutes the epiphany of the feminine”
Levinas interprets Aristophanes’ myth as the very disaster of Eros, the defeating of desire in incest
Levinas feminizes contradiction untouchable-touchable
the 2 meanings of “as”: 1) risky comparison, rhetorical 2) appropriate description, phenomenological
[Derrida is so forgiving] even though obvious social/sexual hierarchy, Levinas’ [sexism] occurs in radical asocial vacuum
Levinas: lovers, dual solitude, excludes the third [triple solitude: each partner is solitary and so is the witness], the contrary of social relation > nothing attained, touched w/ caress
Derrida asks: where is borderline (la ligne) btwn beyond possible exceeding [Levinas’] caress, making it possible, and beyond possible that opens the ethical [face?], making it possible?
“loi du tact: tout commence, et la fidélité même, et le serment, par un impardonnable parjure”

death threatens the promise (promise of death), giving to see the mortuary mask in the face beyond face; less the “already-ethical” of caress/profanation than a remainder of shame (reste de honte), of profanation/treachery/perjury in the ethical
is it possible to change climates? I believe not > I don’t really believe this, not in an instant, w/ a loss of memory
the invincible stratagems of Levinas’ caress: a paternal, virile, fraternal, phallocentric filiation > an avowedly shameful confession (movements as irreproachable as they are guilty)
for Levinas, peace is the ethical itself
let’s not play w/ words ever: le tendre ne s’éprouve qu’à tendre (the proof of the tender is only in the tending, extending)
for Levinas, the peace that is ethical found more in the tender caress that renounces possession than in erotic violence acharnée à jouir

w/out playing on words, never: il faudrait donc entendre et tendre tendrement ces mots—tender, tend, extend > “Tiens!”: “Take (Prends)!” (tender it, à tendre on sous-entend) is not “I give you (je te donne)” (obscene phrase: assumed certainty, expected recognition)
“Tiens!”: that the other grasp or seize, keep what one extends to him, giving to “touch”
for Nancy, offering in the gift is the “withdrawal of the gift,” of its being-present
touch gives nearness/proximity more than sight/hearing > proximity, proper, present
one thinks first of all, and too much, of hands: take the gift (“Tiens!”), comprehension, prehension, captation, a plea (prière) > “tender extending” becomes violence itself: “Take that!”
operation that inscribed some touching in all writing, surg-ical, Greek cheirourgia, cheir (hand), ergon (work) > even if machines/technology are indispensable

periodization: no cutting, indivisible limit, no simple instant or agency btwn a before and an after (impossible to prove): to find the premises of aftereffects it suffices to sharpen (d’aiguiser) one’s reading [there’s a past from before the markable beginning]
Nancy’s heart transplant, l’intrus, is not the quasi-transcendental strangeness that refers to all our “I’s,” and yet… [the 2 strangenesses keep making signs toward one another]
Nancy: limit must come to be touched not seen
for Berkeley, infinite abyss btwn what we see and what we touch

Gospel as a general haptics, flesh that is touching–touched > “le salut sauve en touchant, et le sauveur, à savoir le touchant, est aussi touché: sauvé, sauf, indemne—touché par la grâce” > touching, purify, heal, save, extend hand [heal blindness by touching eyes = touch before sight]
Jesus in pity (misertus/splagchnistheis)—he was moved, touched, his bleeding heart moves him to touch
origin of fetishism [?], desire to touch what touches Jesus’ body (garments), touching w/out touching > made safe, immune, by faith of what touch signifies (not by touch itself)
touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss
for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision
philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline

there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure) p. 105 untouchable, the excess of inaccessible beyond, the origin of figural fiction: le toucher
philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it
history of untouchable: immune, sound, safe, “sauf—le toucher”

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: for Nancy, sublime: imagination feeling its powerlessness as it touches the limit (limit conceived as height, absolute height)

cela se touche: “it itself touches itself,” “one touches it, it lets itself be touched” > imagination: possibility auto-affecting its essence of a nonessence: it is touched, in a movement de retrait ou de re-pli, becomes at moment it touches untouchable [re: imagination “touching” sublime]
untouchable, the excess of inaccessible beyond, the origin of figural fiction: le toucher
that we only have 5 senses, that each one is distinct: a praxis, way of being social, habit of some pretended ontophenomenological evidence
Derrida jokingly scolds himself for scolding Nancy: stop using this incredible vocabulary > abstain from ‘touching,’ ce concept sans répondant assuré: figures w/out figure, therefore w/out credit
Derrida poking fun at himself, how he’s abstaining from touching Nancy, claiming touch is impossible–prohibited, and we love to call this loving—abstaining, like the Messiah
touch more proper (Berkeley, Aristotle, Husserl, Maine de Biran)
would figure of limit have to be tangible? isn’t the tangible the very contamination of the proper, of contamination itself, of contact/contagion/impurification?
syncope, interruption in contact, a history of never touching touch
touch another sex, touch one’s limit, se toucher le sexe
phone sex: phantasm of ecstatic pleasure promises pleasure (through phainesthai)
laughter, especially a peal or burst, is like a syncope, even if it shakes up whole body—it’s a thing of the mouth
interruption of auto-affection of mouth imparts speech [?]

for Nancy, touching is very experience of “origin” as “plural singularity” > being w/ (cum or co-), community as co-tact > se toucher soi-même, se toucher l’un l’autre ou les uns les autres [French grammar tolerates reflexive in singular & plural]
French grammar’s tolerance of reflexiveness in plural & singular: subject of book
touch does not come as easily to Derrida as it does to Nancy—isn’t Nancy’s [every] origin “appropriable”?
Derrida not more idealist, history of touch is idealistic—“cannot bring myself to believe in it very much”
[but] the idea is seen rather than touched
weep, weigh, think, complain, laugh [think each transitively & intransitively]
Nancy writes partes extra partes obsessively to break w/ immediacy of touch, challenge law of intuition at heart of contact
Phaedo, Republic: touch truth, relinquish corporeal senses

philosophy—idealization, intuitionism as philosophy itself, where seeing the blind spot, a point, is touching it > fullness of immediate presence: actuality of what se donne en acte, energetically, effectively: hapto-tropologic metaphysics comes to its plenitude, pleroma
epekeina tēs ousias (hyphen btwn Plato/Plotinus): Plotinus’ hyperbolic touching of the One as the Good, beyond being
desire is intuitionistic—as soon as it’s weaned (sevré) of intuition > lethal contradiction, sign of its end, its telos (telos is haptico-intuitionistic)
Plato, Bergson, Berkeley, Maine de Biran, Husserl all carry out same formal constraint: haptical intuitionism fulfills well-known hegemony of eidetics (eye, figure, incorporal look)
philosophy obediently under thumb of finger and eye
Bergson’s beautiful program: convergence of all the senses (still a hierarchy)
order of presences via haptical (if it was a finger point, command)
intuitive vision becomes contact
Deleuze & Guattari’s preference of “haptic” to “tactile”: proximity > a continuistic postulation of desire, “smooth,” “body w/out organs”
purely smooth, “body w/out organs” —Artaud’s great Christian fantasy: smooth/striated is an idealizing polarity
Deleuze & Guattari’s privilege of de jure over de facto privileges the striated (state power), already implicated in the problematic opposition [smooth/striated]
who could finish w/ this tempting postulation? [i.e. “smooth” desire]
w/ each blow, at every blow, Nancy dodges continuistic tradition while insisting on tactile

intuitionistic-continuistic logic of immediacy as irrepressible as desire itself, as intractable as language constraints, grammatical violence > this law has to happen, symptoms will crop up [does Nancy really avoid this logic?]
Nancy moves dialecticized Judeo-Christian-Islamic “fellow” (residing in particular and universal) into technē > the true “creation” and “art” of our world

so Nancy partagerait (would shares out and part) the senses, touching too; he does this by adding definite article “le” to toucher, then declaring there’s no “the touch”; Derrida compares this to propre, proche, même; then asks how we could write w/out them, without making believe we believe? asking the other to believe > le temps d’une rature qui viendra signer l’acte de foi partagée et partager (diviser, inquiéter, morceler) l’acte de foi, la foi même?
ontology of presence: pleonasm
always writing a story, tangent touches line/surface w/out intersection, a tangent touches one point, point is nothing, a limit w/out depth or surface, untouchable even as a figure
to continually tell a story, start again, stems (tient) from impossible alliance of contact & syncope
Nancy’s power of powerlessness, possibility of the impossible
“my impertinence will be my tact”: baroque composition, flaunted taste for delirious profusion > response to aporias of text
shouldn’t sense of touch touch us, for something to come about at last (pour que quelque chose arrive enfin), an event, as some say, fatiguing us a little, a singular event (!!) [: )]?
touching upon the demande (plea) of touch: “comment toucher, sans y toucher, au sens du toucher?”
as if idea of simultaneity/continuity born in contact w/ contact btwn 2 points of contact
to be able to touch: birth of simul btwn us
touching has potential or power to touch personal pronoun “who” and definite article “what”
touching-power (pouvoir le toucher): 1) force of power, free, sovereign, potency 2) reserved virtuality, dunamis, capability
law of substitution, from substitution as law: the 3rd interrupts (distances) w/out interrupting (distancing)
question of touch belongs to history of body, to “my body” (hoc est emin corpus meum), to history of Europe having it out w/ its “Christianity”
how to say anything that doesn’t get invested in these historical figures [of touch], their rhetorical circle, and their logical, hermeneutical twirling (tourbillon)?
il, illeity, 3rd, “unrectitude”: certain rectitude would reduce its transcendence
touch is finitude, period, stop at this point > l’efforcement (forceful exertion) always signs a finitude

to follow the history of touch, follow the hand as a sample (échantillon), more or less well sewn, following like un fil conducteur, follow the turns of the hand, and especially its finger > see what it circumscribes, and what it lets slip away (laisse échapper)
Derrida tells Nancy [humorously?] to not let this megalovirus [touch] contaminate you, stop using these words > leave it to the ancestors

self-relation, “s’efforcer” > institutes/born to itself as exertion moment when limit insists, resists > efforcement as effort/limit, a finite force s’arrête, and se replie toward itself depuis sa fin ——objectivity of being(s): 1) exposed before a gaze 2) opposes a resistance to touch > does the hand (being-before-the-hand) reconcile these two positional values of objectivity?
objectivity of being(s): 1) exposed before a gaze 2) opposes a resistance to touch > does the hand (being-before-the-hand) reconcile these two positional values of objectivity?
force & virtual force (Jesus recognizes this mysterious force when someone touches him)
Husserl & Kant begin w/ received impression, sensation, the “primary faculty” > thus we only imagine force, only know its phenomenal effects [?]
Descartes’ stick of the blind: 6th sense
touch as genus, touch as exceptional: mobile, motor activity as the essence of touch
for Maine de Biran, passive is to active as sensory is to motor
for Kant & Levinas, brothers, irruption of equality, thus of the 3rd
for Merleau-Ponty, “synaesthetic perception” is the rule: “co-existence of sentient & sensible” > a philosophy of immediate coincidence

Merleau-Ponty: “absolute knowledge is not detachment, it is inherence,” “intuition is definitely not simply coincidence or fusion any more, it is extended to ‘limits’”; p. 343n M-P, acc. Derrida, still coincides—even w/ a “non-coincidence”
acc. de Biran, touch as transcendental, “faculty of movement,” withdraws from order of sensibility: exemplary sense (comparing other “senses” to touch: more or less sense on both sides of analogy)
M-P: sensation a form of communion, eating bread [Eucharist]
de Biran: the mobility of the eye is why sight most closely related to touch [i.e. mobility]
smell most passive sense: pure sensation
[Levinas on the 3rd and the face]

de Biran, faculty of movement: “willing subject,” twinning (jumeler) the stem (souche): ego w/out ego before ego—1) touch as motor will 2) touch as pure sensibility > combines thinking of force w/ thinking of virtual [see TN p. 136]
via de Biran, sense of “I” comes from hand: rough, too heavy resistance > he would know nothing about himself, if he did not experience resistance
Maine de Biran’s “humanualism (humainisme)”: only humans have hand, can touch in strongest sense (that elephant trunk “approximates” hand of man maintains hierarchy)
hierarchy/teleology [au sommet]: willing subject, quasi-sense that is touch (ultrasense), the hand [the whole hand, not just tip of an extremely pointy fingernail (ongle extrêmement aigu)]
for de Biran, the hand is irreplaceable/dominant (teleological) and it’s pregnant w/ every kind of metonymy (pedagogical): best ontoteleological figure, best rhetorical figure
hand, humanism, continuistic intuitionism, natural immediacy > so many celebrations of touching
“transcendentalism” always guided by such surreptitious exemplarism
touch as middle term > where interval of divisibility is indivisible, continuism
Ravaisson doesn’t even stop at hand, his spiritualism/finalism overflows humanity of human (thus the hand), ontoteleology of life, ontotheology of desire/grace (freedom of spirit)
Ravaisson’s withdrawal of hand, does it get replaced, secretly, w/ hand of God? how does this figure of God’s hand relate to light, to flesh, to Incarnation, to Christ’s touch?

the 3 values of exemplarism [re: hand/touch]: 1) l’échantillon quelconque (random sample), indifferent 2) teleological value—best example 3) et surtout, un simulacre d’échantillon dont le symptôme trahirait une autre téléologie cachée: symptom of a metonymy, because touch always has been figural, some figural substitute courant sans fin to its “proper” abyss
Husserl offers hand as an example of free, spontaneous, immediate movement of ego-subject
“eidetic” figure of optical intuitionism always confirms/fulfills itself in an intuition tactually filled-in & in hyperbole of continuistic haptocenteredness
Nancy’s freedom no longer refers to an egological subject
for Husserl, fingers that touch (not signal, not show) deem contact the experience of presence, which is full, immediate, direct (Nancy’s syncope interrupts)
auto-deictic function of finger turns back on itself: le se-sentir-toucher du doigt est aussitôt un se-sentir-touché du doigt [Doppelempfindungen]
no tear (déchirure) possible in Levinas’ text w/out a certain notching (échancrure) of the 2nd moment, and certain contamination btwn the 2 > he likes the tear, he detests contamination
[footnoting Irigaray] finger/hand not only “auto-affecting” body part
Husserl leads us back to purely psychic ego (Descartes) > not necessarily human

“principle of principles” gives us no choice [?]: commands us to begin w/ “us,” that is, w/ most proper, proximate Ego; this “man,” this “we” comes before most radical phenomenological reduction, the one that suspends the world
pure psychology parallels pure transcendental phenomenology
contamination is no longer a risk but a fate that must be assumed
Husserl: man filled w/ soul through & through
teleological hierarchy, axiological scale: phenomenology begins w/ man

for Levinas, in search of God uncontaminated by Being, contact is a priori contamination > graver yet: risk of contamination that surfaces before contact, in necessity of tying interruptions together (insistence of ruptures)
for Husserl, the incomparable unity of touch: its reflexive double sensation (touching, touched)
handless animals can touch!
handless animals can touch!
for Husserl, rigorous philosopher avoids everyday language w/ its as and as ifs (gleichsam) > he should recall us to evidence itself

for Husserl, where sight requires the technical [to see itself] (in sense of mediation and in sense of “intruder”), touch’s self-relation is immediate, spontaneous, direct, intuitive and acts w/out empathy or analogical appresentation
for Husserl, when I touch myself w/ my finger: no haptical mirror-effect, no insinuation of alterity
for Husserl, “we,” (who is this we?) immediately note difference btwn sight and touch
sight is mediated even by a mirror
German mit translated as en même temps > temporal coincidence gives intuitive plenitude (immediacy of time can’t be thematized—only argued by paralipsis [?])
Husserl: “originally” not used here in temporal-causal sense but refers to “a primal group of Objects constituted directly in intuition (direkt anschaulich)”
if foreign outside, space of material thing, slips btwn touching/touched, i.e. the heterogeneity of spacing > won’t a hand touching itself experience this detour?
for Husserl, duplicity of sensible impression/apprehension occurs via a certain necessary exteriority, an outside as “real quality of a thing” (it partakes even in illusions)
phenomenology finds greatest resistance where extension, place, localization are at issue > nous abordons ainsi une zone de spatialité, extension of the psyche
pause for a moment (pour s’arrêter un instant)
for Husserl, introjection is a late, upper layer of experience
can there be solipsism w/out introjection? “I” requires intersubjectivity?
but could I feel my heart w/out technē or grammar (grammar, like rhetoric, a form of technē)?
Husserl analyzes solipsism w/ figure of manual touching and Herzgefühl, “heart sensation”
Husserl struggles to describe the self-touch of the heart, w/out appealing to double apprehension of hand > heart sensation beneath the surface when you push on your chest [?]
[Husserl utilizes a Hegel-like mediate immediacy re: touch]
[Husserl on what happens when I touch another’s hand]

intruder on inside, constitutively haunted by some hetero-affection related to spacing, a host, a parasite, pharmakon, ghost: [each of these figures] habite en revenant tout for intérieur (inhabit one’s heart of hearts as a ghost)
there would be auto-affection “effects,” but their analysis can’t escape hetero-affection that makes them possible, keeps haunting them

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: constitution of body proper would thus assume passage outside through “technē of bodies,” spacing, death, nonliving, other, mourning > everything the “solipsistic” tries to keep out (maintenir au-dehors)

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: irreducible spacing: first word of any deconstruction
how the hand led us to the other surface, the other of sense, while trying to demonstrate auto-affection
Derrida’s 5 Tangents, chapters (5 fingers, 5 senses); hand as incarnation of logos > hand of son of God
any inheritance or filiation worthy of such names: transform, re-begin, re-invent, divert, sometimes also betrayal (trahison)
Husserl wants to be more Cartesian than Descartes

while discussing Levinas’ and [a certain] psychoanalysis’ secondarization of the woman, Derrida hypothesizes [?] that this complicit gesture gathers around one fundamental design: their relation to me, to the other as woman
“too large for dimensions of present essay” [chapter title has exorbitant in it]
connection btwn “self-touching” of “human body” [flesh] and body of Christian ontotheology, its eucharistic ecstasy par excellence [Nancy too?]
humainisme
“I am speaking from my place as woman”
Merleau-Ponty’s originary here, origin of world, an “I can”
Merleau-Ponty diverts from Husserl while claiming accuracy: more interested in sensible reflexivity, discourse on flesh & incarnation, becoming-touch, becoming-visible of touch
as a woman, by reversing dissymmetry [of tout autre in Levinas], Derrida has added rape [alongside other violences: hostage, persecution, etc.]
Levinas contaminates when he thematizes the nonthematizable, Derrida contaminates this irrepressible thematization in his turn (not structurally, but w/ a fault of his own)

Derrida defends Husserl’s stubborn conviction that we can’t know alter-ego, only through analogy, appresentation, that there’s an unbridgeable abyss (abîme infranchissable) > Husserl’s stance prevents risk of an immediate intutionism of the other
the difference Derrida adds to Husserl’s alter-ego: recognize l’irréductible écart even in the touchant-touché de ma “propre” main [there’s alter-ego in my own proper body as human ego]

pre-originary mourning (re: Husserl’s vigilant stance on alter-ego) tied to motif of exappropriation—interiorization, even introjection, never achieved [Derrida has more in common w/ Husserl than Merleau-Ponty?]

[Derrida’s universality]: convey to “every man’s” ear that world of each person is untranslatable, that there’s never the “same world” > not incompatible premises, condition/call for one another [deconstruction Merleau-Ponty]
Nancy: no art of touch, touch is sense as threshold
syncope is this partage of spacing
Nancy, partage—parting, sharing, spacing, syncope, irreducible partition, gives “it” a chance menacée, heartbeat’s the other’s beat (le même battement—de l’autre, du coeur de l’autre)
Husserl never solved the riddle of Einfühling (empathy)
Merleau-Ponty’s “it is a non-coincidence I coincide w/ here” can only be upset by thinking cum otherwise, w/ Nancy: “the other turns out to be the other of the w/”
law of parting/sharing at heart of con-tact: “inoperative community”

touching w/out touching, touching in passing the touchable > “time to space itself,” “espace du passage qui fait donc partage” [spacing-time], the time needed for touching [co-existence as w/, as other]
Nancy: Heidegger and Husserl as 2 “styles of the essentiality of the with”
Heidegger: thesis that all cognition aims at intuition has temporal meaning that all cognition aims at making present
Heidegger: from Parmenides to Husserl, sight privileged as unique access to beings & Being
[gestures of hand in Heidegger]
aristocracy of one sense, or democracy of all: these battles due to tropological displacements, originary prosthetic possibilities; prosthetics never wait, Nancy’s “technē of bodies”
no optical intutitionism w/out haptocentrism, where smooth is blind, deaf, impassive > feel & taste, touch a bit of everything
Merleau-Ponty’s invisible w/ visible

Merleau-Ponty: visual experience is truer than tactical experience > yet, since M.-P. often uses “example of hand,” Derrida will follow a few of his lines (ses lignes) [i.e. lines of the hand] whose tracings brouille une statique des frontières that would stabilize “parallelism” or establish privilege
“example of the hand” confirms anthropology of Merleau-Ponty’s phenomenology of perception
for Merleau-Ponty, is vision the infrastructure of “thought”? > Merleau-Ponty: a unique touch that accompanies us through all experiences
[“we” feel/touch anthropology/humanism?]
Derrida explains why Merleau-Ponty’s denial of an anthropological interpretation is unconvincing [here, Derrida is really trying to be nice, even says so]
what counts most in imminence? what it expects, or that it is doomed to wait?
Merleau-Ponty’s virtual synthesis of presentiment: the spanning (enjambement) “by the total being of my body” &, at the same time, the interruptions that don’t allow for spanning
[Derrida’s not going to close off Merleau-Ponty in spite of disappointment]

[beyond Foucault] mouvance (trend) of thinking, not path or line (neo-Heideggerian[?]), structurally open unlike epistēmē, “paradigm,” which hypothesize historical space w/in strictly determinable contour > I read texts profitably and make unfair selections
Nancy’s partager: 1) affinity, crossings, “tangency” 2) a partitioning, un autre départ: this alterity of bodies follows the line partly of the technical & partly of a beyond Christianity
idiomatic singularity of a gesture is never pure or purely reappropriable and it can’t be separated from a scene, strategy, discursive tactics [where’s the bridge, the passage?]
[re: Nancy quote] violently excerpted: reread everything around it [few pages later: need to read on]
[more on (im)possibility of deconstructing Christianity] salvation from Christianity is a Christian value: Bataille’s hyperbolic mask, what he sometimes called his “hyper-Christianity”

“a lieu et tient lieu: a lieu tout en tenant lieu, a lieu pour tenir lieu…” [this goes on, Derrida then compares taking the place of to translation, where it is a considerable event in thinking; 356n TN. “thank you”]

“cet espacement fait l’épreuve du non-contact comme la condition ou l’expérience même du contact, l’expérience même du même à jamais ouverte (forever open)—et par l’autre espacée” [hiatus of noncontact at heart of contact]
singularity takes place and takes place of (a lieu et tient lieu), inscribing technical prosthetics onto singularity of event itself, because of this spacing: takes place, l’événement d’une venue
Nancy: “created body” is a tautology [what else but body is created?], body is the coming into presence as being this screen [no depth]
Nancy’s technē deconstructs system of ends: always “technē of the next one (du prochain)”
mechanical technique (esp. machines) as a simulacrum of “sensible”—does not feel itself feel, does not hierarchize the “5 senses”: opens place for metonymic substitution
one should take the technical supplement into account
to proclaim “essential originarity” of technical [as Nancy does] translates this “law” into a classical language that meets its limit here
la ligne de partage [Derrida’s playing w/ dividing line] btwn Nancy’s corpus on touch and the other ones
when Nancy lets the other body co-appear (comparaître), doesn’t mean “come into presence,” but to “come” as hôte not shutting the door à l’arrivance de l’hôte
event, la venue de l’arrivant, routs (met en déroute) and exceeds any performative power
Nancy links a dissemination of haptics w/ body’s technical character
[Nancy beautifully describes minimally deferred contact, promise of contact in reading]
Nancy: space of bodies not acquainted w/ Death (space abolished) (being-toward-death) but knows each body as a dead one, sharing out for us the extension of his/her “ci-gît (here lies)”
Nancy: phenomenology touches/exceeds its own limit in Cartesian Meditations > “pré-donation of the alter-ego”
for Didier Franck (cf. Chair et corps), flesh as a pre-given of time; Derrida asks why would that which is always given in time need to precede it?
chair, carnal: cherishing and dear (carus), caritas, incarnation (caro, carnis)
differance btwn 2 surfaces: condition of contact & originarily spaced opening that calls for technical prosthetics (makes it possible w/out delay)

anesthetic interruption in heart of aesthetic phenomenality, anesthetics very ecstasy at heart of pleasure, pleasure as differance w/out delay > plier, prier and invent substitutes, prostheses, fetishes, cultures, technics (all of “history,” before and beyond “hand of man”)
differance as condition of contact
for Derrida, epochē divides contact at its heart, anesthetizing it from the threshold of its possibility, for 2 reasons: 1) suspends reality of contact 2) noematic can’t pertain to touched thing

Franck’s forced interpretation of Husserl places hyletic sensuality of flesh (contact, self-contact) before time: Franck overruns intentional analytic toward existential one, then overruns existential analytic > flesh opens time: archefacticity as con-tingency
Derrida obeys thematic focus [for a bit?]
intertwining btwn present/nonpresent ensures presence of alter-ego in heart of ego
not everything re: “flesh” is Christian, but…
leibhaftig as incarnate? does Leib have flesh? > what about machine-bodies, technical supplements, which are both Körper and Leib [p. 361n Derrida points to his early work on Husserl]
[re: Franck’s translation of leibhaftig] risks of effacing when interpreting through such an active translation

Franck’s happy, lucky condensation of word con-tingency [used as alibi?]: contingere: touching, attaining, also happening (arriver), befalling (échoir), falling to one’s lot or part (tomber en partage): essential facticity of this evenementialité aléatoire resists eidetic variation
Franck’s caress is sexed > caress before shock/blow? [Heideggerian like double blow?]
Derrida not sure one “flesh” can only be compared to another acc. sexuality, acc. “a” or “the” sexual difference
“politic” pertains to essence of every community? doubt it
to marginalize partes extra partes (nonliving, divisible, that which belongs as something foreign to flesh, a supplementary, transplanted graft) risks marginalizing the margin?
when ichfremd [though affirmed] returns to the proper, rebecomes/remains egological

anthropocentric privilege fails to consider: 1) ultimate reduction of world 2) anything that’s not “human flesh,” i.e. technical prostheses 3) historicity that produces-human-beings-and-technics 4) that privileging human frees path toward Christian body
Chrétian dyssemtrisizes reflexivity of touching, places other exceeding the “I” at the carnal heart (coeur charnal) of ego [no thought more forceful in linking “flesh” to Christianity]
acc. Jean Louis Chrétian, toucher autre chose—toucher de l’autre…if touching nothing, not touching
touch as consent (Rilke), transitivity
[see CHRISTIANITY for Jean-Louis Chrétian’s haptocentrism]

for Aquinas, spiritual touching, pure act, no intervallic medium (transcends value of affect), not temporal but eternal: like pure act or Prime Mover, a touch foreign to sensibility: (ordinary/extraordinary) history of Christian language

no denial in Chrétian of body’s historicity: no abstract historicity w/out a history of touch, no essential archefacticity [Franck’s flesh?]; no thinking (Heidegger’s) of Offenbarkeit more originary than Offenbarung

Chrétian’s carnal figure of a spiritual touch, conversion of body (becoming-flesh) marked by historical event of revelation (Christian body): Incarnation, the Eucharist, by the giving, announcing, promising, and memory of Hoc est meum corpus
divine spirit as flame, sets itself on fire, figure of love & desire which spiritualizes hapto-onto-theo-teleology of Christian flesh > highest possibility
Christian body as post-sin, post-Incarnation historical body
the becoming-love of Aristotelian desire (orxeis) [?], spontaneity of a causa sui
Chrétian’s contingency: experience of created humanity, historical contingency of creature that “comes after it [divine spirit],” lets itself be touched by the self-enflamed
Aristotelian God is now infinite & discontinuous [before, just discontinuous?]

start from fire to think the touching of self-touching > not only fire but flames, since light means what is more than a figure: haptical light of self-consuming flames eludes worship, burns effigies spontaneously, “more than a figure,” the transfiguration of figurality

Chrétian’s divine touch: immediate transitivity, dissymmetry—and reciprocity; w/ Jew, w/ Levinas’s caress, dissymmetry is an excess over me: no reciprocity/mutuality in experience of divine [p. 252 both Chrétian & Levinas capitalize the Son—Il, Fil?]
for Chrétian, infinite touching announces itself already in the finite
Derrida notes, isn’t touching unrepresentable presence the best description of touching?
for Chrétian, hand of father is logos and Son (p. 255 Incarnation is the sign of the hand)
for Chrétian, immediate plenitude of haptical fulfillment is infinite (Christianization of Aristotle’s pure act)
Chrétian admits to a veil in finite touch, a “phenomenological occultation” of the creature
immediacy of touch [its illusion] may be most widespread philosophical naiveté
for Chrétian, logos [le Verbe, the Word] is revealed to man (call of responsibility), but not his property
the 3 universals of touch: 1) common to all living beings 2) whole body, flesh 3) covers whole field of the sensible
[via Chrétian] for Aristotle, hand is “organ of organs,” can become anything because it is nothing, like the soul, touch w/out organs > this feeds into a thinking of Christian flesh
hand has a privilege for Aristotle, but not as the organ of touch
[heterotautology?] transitivism: flesh wants a hand, God’s hand, must go beyond hand of man, then come back to Incarnation, to flesh, to receive hand of man from God
hand of man analogous w/ God’s (logos of this analogy could mean proportional relation)
for Aristotle, absolute touching of pure actuality: nous in immediate contact w/ noēton
God’s hand not a figuration, the hand in the proper sense, the hand of salvation, le main de l’à-dieu (the God-ward goodbye hand)

how to go from unfigurable to figurable (God to man’s hand) > question of passage, figural transfer—but one answer: passage, like Incarnation, Passion, Transubstantiation, mediation btwn infinite immediate & finite medium, btwn infinite & singular finite—is logos fashioned into flesh, the Son, the Hand of the Merciful Father [heterotautology]

spacing & “distance” are thought by Chrétian [by Christian theology of flesh], reduced to phenomenology of finitude, que le toucher spirituel (infini, immédiat, etc.) aura commencé par élever et relever [differance serving to close closure]
theological thinking of flesh leaves no room for question of animal, technics
incarnation will never be phenomenon of an irreducible finitude

Derrida tempted to let himself be tempted to think, to desire, the least venial, least expiable temptation: substitution w/out sacrifice > would the neutral spacing (the khōra) offer hospitality to this substitution of substitution or detain it forever as a hostage?
insistence that comes down to thinking, no longer a simple rhetorical movement
Nancy’s necessary, great neologism: expeausition
Nancy on Enlightenment to come: never renounce thought, philosophy, knowledge > Nancy never renounces pertinence, he is so resolute, even at heart of ecstasy, of sacrifice

motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

content: lexicon of touch risks being ruined by abusive spending (dépense absuive) > an eschatological, postwar inflation (desperate call for new “era,” “provenance”) > apocalyptic symptomatology of “deconstruction of Christianity”: all we speak is “touching”

Nancy, spending like a madman: ontologizes everything that comes down to “touching,” jusqu’à la ruine, les ressources, le crédit, le capital et les intérêts du transcendental-ontologique > reduces them [all resources/capital figures of touch] to monetary simulacrum

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

content: finite thinking: a limit that thinking touches w/out appropriating it for itself
via Nancy’s finite thinking, infinitism of Christian flesh finds itself contesté at heart of l’attestation itself > we have no access to it but to refer touch to the limit
dissociate “sense” from truth (Husserl’s distinction btwn pure grammar and logical pure grammar [?])
Nancy’s L’intrus: technical & metaphysical adventure
touch as self-touching—le toucher plus tout autre sens (dizzy rhetoric), very form of space & time & will (essence of will) (from Descartes to Kant or even to Nietzsche)
to will is to will to touch, strange tautology, bends/folds oneself back into fold of passive-active auto-affection > this affect, that inflects/conjugates passive activity of will: desire
touch is quasi-transcendental-ontologization, quasi because touchable of touch gives itself over as untouchable (se donne comme intouchable)—figuring, fictionalizing itself
copula in Nancy’s “le sens est le toucher” is suspended, cautiously, and also insistent, also it has a transitive, active movement: touch touching on touch itself: le sens (est), touches touch
philosophers, meddlers who can’t keep their hands off anything, insatiable polymorphous perversity, imperious encyclopedism
only touch means you’re touched: you’re not seen when you see
Nancy: writing is violent exhaustion of the discourse in which “all sense” is altered in exscribed body
for Chrétian, Christ is one, common body, not a plurality of bodies > Chrétian & Nancy deal w/ a different “yes,” or a different provenance of same “yes,” addressed to “you”
se toucher toi—unforgettable event, sans example, deprives us of all “for example,” an event from which one should re-partir, to prepare for another departure (autre départ)
reflexivity of se toucher toi of 2 borders (bords) does not submit to logic of mirror, speculum
eyes touch btwn 2 orients: invisible eye (touchable), seeing eye (untouchable)
diastole, absolute generosity, generosity more generous than generosity itself, orients us toward epekeina tēs ousisas, Plotinus’ One
heart: condition of desire, the effraction of the other, of what can’t return to self

the heart of this other heart cannot be touched, does not touch itself, it self touches you; it is the heart insofar as m’appartient à toi ——for there to be a good heart: possibility of bad heart must remain forever open, i.e. tout autre > good heart must be ready for the other, for treachery, for perjury (inevitable-impossible vow of abstinence, tactile’s fate); is this how we can translate Kant’s “evil heart”?
that which can’t be sublated, the dissemination of essence (of the One) > dissemination pluralizes any singularity that allows one to say “the” touch, “the” body
Nancy’s corpus as dissemination and body
you beat the heart, you interrupt circulation
this other heart that self touches you, gives pleasure where pleasure’s made more intense by not returning to me, diastole w/out systole > the ecstatic & haptical sans of “sans revenir à soi”
Nancy knows better than to capitalize “the” sense of touch w/ any semantic capital > none of the senses are assured, even if it can be quoted in the stock market
Nancy: “touch” as limit of sense, and the limit of senses is to be taken in all senses, each of which breaks into (fait effraction) the other
Nancy’s “yes”: consent to touch a body to come
it’s because there’s some technical (which there is not) that one can infinitely repeat examples that deconstruct very properness/unity itself of all essences, “beings”
via Nancy, there is no “the” technical is an exemplary example, plus qu’un exemple, gives privileged access to all “there is no ‘the’…”’s > le vertige quasi transcendantal
Nancy’s “there is no ‘the’…” could deprive him of any conceptual determination, or hand over the discourse to irresponsible empiricism > Socrates has been teaching us this for years
Derrida’s “if there is any (s’il y en a)” vs. Nancy’s “there is no ‘the’” > two irreducibly different deconstructions (one turns to a conditional, the other to a negative modality)
s’il y en a: pure & unconditional in so many forms (event, invention, gift, forgiving, witnessing, hospitality, and so on)
limit, border (bord), which are nothing, make any gift (don) possible
diastole w/out systole, interruption risks death at every moment, other heart se touche toi only to be exteposed to death: toi es (t) aussi ma mort [at heart of a finite thinking]
[re: Nancy’s list of touchable bodies] finite series, symphonic “yes” of pleasure
my heart is first of all the other’s, greater than my heart in my heart

you, metronome of my heteronomy, you resist my dreams of a reappropriating movement of self-presence, self-consciousness, absolute knowledge, which is why I love you, so painfully, at heart of pleasure itself
[quasi-bibliography of Nancy on heart]
“heart”: ultimate place of mourning, sanctuary of what one keeps when one can’t keep anything, name of what infinitely exceeds the inside
you break me from dialectic (which does not exclude it)
w/out l’épreuve of impossibility of auto-affection—no love

the “self” is as indispensable as you in se toucher toi, an “I” unable to touch itself couldn't se plier à ce qui le déplie absolument, au tout autre qui, comme tout autre, habite mon coeur en étranger > no anthropological limit here > “divine,” “animal,” & life all derivative of se toucher toi
pure life & pure death: infinitely the same
all-powerful logic of narcissism: not as experience of gaze but as painfully ironic discourse of confession that mimics appropriable of unappropriable
il faut s’aimer [French grammar: puts transitivity in reflexivity] says every “I love you” > this (impossible) auto-affection of love makes love possible
quasi-hyper-transcendental-ontologization of tact (and not of touch) must remain paradoxical [Derrida has replaced touch w/ tact]
Novalis: only authentic philosophical act is suicide > first kiss and suicide [?]
auto-hetero-affection inaugurates all experience: speech, declaration of love
exigo, ex-ago: to push, finish, require (exiger), on time [punctual]
Redlichkeit (probity), exactitude can be a virtue (relation of a “who” to a “whom”), not just objective measure (a “what”)
to touch as tact, thanks to you, because of you, is to break (rompre) w/ immediacy wrongly associated w/ touch (in ontology, self-presence, transcendental idealism, body proper, etc.)
Nancy’s “transgression” close to Derrida’s “originary perjury as inevitable as  it is unforgivable”
Nancy: [breast or heart?] the word for modesty w/out shame
Derrida finds a passage in Nancy that confirms all he tried to formulate before he came across it, declares: (how lucky I am!)

touche à (touches on, tampers w/) la limite, there untouchable is tangible, presents itself as inaccessible to the tactile, in tact (i.e. impossible) > vow of abstinence avows (before one keeps or betrays it) transgression, perjury, unforgivable profanation in fidelity

tact (touch w/out contact) > avowal of impossible confession: confession is perjurious, confession is inexpiable, is the fault > le vertige of comedy that absorbs (aspire) every confession, tragedy of lies in good faith, lies w/ hand on heart
one never touches except by touching a limit at (à) the limit (truism in any profound thinking of limit)
pudeur: elle déploie ses voiles à l’infini > must must not, because can can’t (confess/betray)
la loi marque ainsi le sans dan le sens ou dans l’existence ——a “must (devoir)” worthy (digne) of the name must remain foreign to an economy of debt [w/out alibi]
touch is finitude, period
what one doesn’t touch is part of what we call touch, and a part greater than the whole it designates; intangible (pas-pouvoir-toucher) [capacity], untouchable (ne-pas-devoir-toucher) [ethics]
touch is finitude, period

logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)
one would also have to integrate the rhetoric, plus qu’une rhétorique quand elle franchit à chaque figure the limits btwn sensible/intelligible—finding itself on both sides of the limit
compassion, if there is any: l’épreuve of impossible compatibility
malgré la pensée, thought thinks only in spite of itself, never begins by itself [Nancy’s peser]
die Härte (hardness): [classically] touch resists virtualization
“facts of the day” [i.e. computer, cybersex], artefactual haunts and works through technics & desire (and work in general)—same labor, same pleasure, same torture, tripalium
dream of kissing Nancy, real friends intimidate me, as do my sons
strange couple of 2 tactilities: appropriate necessity (pertinent), singulier aléatoire (contingent)

Derrida’s offering [the text] will touch Nancy in a way this is both necessary/contingent: pertinere [as necessary] doesn’t fail to touch, is cocky, arrogant, impertinent; contingency: finite being [Derrida] would like to touch a singularity [Nancy], hic et nunc, in its [his] body
quotation marks (guillemets): touching word as if w/ tweezers (pincettes), as if it were contaminated in advance > “touch”
[re: Nancy’s “touch freedom!”] hyperbole, exact exaggeration, overbid in the impossible
the selfsame (même) heart exappropriates instant touched by other, no possible reappropriation (absolute mourning)
apparently, women respond better to heart grafts [?]

eyes meet, infinitely, mouths in contact [unsatisfied w/ insipid figures, however interesting/necessary], thought begins, jusqu’à l’abîme, plunging Narcissus into abyss: makes day or night possible > day and night themselves promising each other, au point du jour
‘hyper,’ surenchère of Nancy
‘hyper,’ surenchère of Nancy
Nancy: epopteia’s only face—Medusa
Nancy: “muscle-bound thinking,” “sacred-heart thinking,” vitalo-spiritualist fascism believes one can touch the sense of “touch,” ideologies of the “body”—w/ secret horror of bodies
Nancy: epopteia, sight accomplished, consummation of Mystery of Sense Certainty, phallic & cephalic
Nancy: epopteia’s only face—Medusa

singularity [never assured] doit être couru comme une chance ou un risque: Nancy’s a bettor, thinker of the bet (pari), a desperate bettor, never stops staking, committing (d’engager), calculating w/ exactitude hyperbolic odds (gages): not counting on gains (bénéfice) of an “argument du pari” [Pascal] or any salut
greatest risk, try to know to “whom,” not about “what,” you’re talking
caress (bad or good) hits like a phone call to the heart
“consentement exaspéré,” un salut exespéré (ex-hoped for salvation), un salut juste à venir (a just salut to come, a salut just on its way…), un salut sans salvation, worthy of the name
for Kant, no need to travel to understand cosmopolitanism when one lives in a bustling city (exemplary Königsberg)
Nancy: self-overcoming quite proper to Christianity
spasm & distension: passage that confirms gap btwn extension and spacing
Nancy’s festering immundity, what is expulsed, the abjected/ejected of (auto-)immune—isn’t law of autoimmunity what commands all Christian thinking of “flesh”?
risk finding that a deconstructed heart is a Christian one
in truth, deconstruction = creation
vow of abstinence: anything but a contact phobia
Derrida tempted to say, not only does [Levinas’] caress border on messianic, the messianic can only be stroked (caressed), only way for messianic to show throw
for Levinas, flesh not reduced to the face
touchable-untouchable, untouchable right on/at (reste à même) the touchable, could only be announced if before any religion, cult, prohibition
Levinas, by way of Husserl, proposes the word sentance to describe an immediate iteration “whose sensation is the event itself”
[Derrida quotes Irigaray on caress]
[re: Nancy’s distinction btwn gift & offering] how can you eschew economics w/ the value of “keeping (garde)”? [Nancy describes how the surprise of the gift is kept]

motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: pregnancy, only a woman can feel the heart of another in her; [Derrida to Nancy before surgery] “Don’t worry, I’ll wake up w/ you,” friend who keeps heart of other, this incredible survival > “heart” joins w/ thinking, w/ grace of gratitude, w/ love of friendship
Plotinus’ pan to sōma: organ of touch the whole body

proper, ipseity, proche, “same” are all deconstructible [but try to speak w/out them!], beyond their pedagogical and rhetorical necessity, what do they ever mean? the law that hatches irresistible desire of appropriation (“my body,” “here”) destines it to expropriation > this desire handed over to promise of expropriation [Derrida is deconstructing Nancy’s “properly”]
Diderot, in tradition of Anaxagoras: “man thinks because he has hands”
Ravaisson: good habit as return to innocence through training
Derrida translates Husserl’s Leib as corps propre, body proper—not chair [pp. 349-50n]
can we efface Christian connotations of chair?
for Husserl, hallucination is like a spontaneous reduction
how could [Husserl’s] identical coincidence open up to anything else?
to show that shaking hands is not always privileged form of greeting, Derrida tells story about his own experience of Maori hongi: greeting by touching noses, weeping even
via Vasseleu [“Touch, Digital Technology and the Ticklish”], Mcluhan's assertion that touch is the sense of electronic age coincides w/ Freudian fear of touching
Merleau-Ponty’s failure to deanthropologize logos, hand still prevails in “hiatus”
for Franck, no localization in general w/out auto-affect, self-contact
acc. Franck, “analytics of incarnation” “overflows” phenomenology
Nancy & Chrétian: dizzying abyss of 2 Christianities > Importance of (not) Being Christian—as if it were possible
Pascal: true sacrifice must be spiritual—the flesh that doesn’t perish [circumcision of heart]

motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

content: letter (touchable), spirit (untouchable), Jews/Christians—who touches more? Hegel’s hardness of Jews
[unable to determine who touches more: Christians or Jews] Muslims are hyperbolic heirs to this endless contradiction [of infinite]: Dieu se contraedit (how can we translate this into English?)
Bergson: all philosophers see one point, a contact more than vision
Nancy might add, the point is not a point (indivisible), but the point, punctuality, is divisible, a touchable limit, spacing forever
Hegel critiques Kant’s hardness (Härte)
Hegel critiques Kant’s Härte > Nancy’s hardness is resolution, courage, severity, inflexibility
